title: Crane Collapse on Train in Thailand Kills 29
snippets: A construction crane for a high-speed rail bridge collapsed onto a passenger train on Wednesday in Thailand, injuring at least 30 people, the government said.
At least 29 people were killed and dozens injured after a construction crane collapsed onto a train in Thailand.
The train, travelling from Bangkok to northeast Thailand, derails when a construction crane falls on it.
A construction crane fell onto a moving passenger train, causing a fiery derailment that killed at least 29 people Wednesday in northeastern Thailand. Another 64 people were injured.
Sixty-four people were left injured, including a one-year-old and an 85-year-old.
At least 25 killed after crane falls on train in Thailand, police say Reuters

Crane was working on a high-speed rail project when it collapsed and hit the passing train, causing it to derail and briefly catch fire At least 22 people in Thailand have been killed and scores injured after a crane collapsed onto a passenger train, derailing it on Wednesday, officials said. Footag
The authorities said there were almost 200 people aboard when the accident happened northeast of Bangkok. Dozens were injured.
The crane, which was being used to construct an elevated highspeed railway, fell onto the moving train causing it to derail and catch fire.

At least 29 people were killed and 64 others injured. The crane was part of a high-speed rail project, and nearly 200 people were on board the train at the time of the accident.

title: Prosecutors Seek Death Penalty for Yoon Suk Yeol in Insurrection Trial
snippets: If Yoon is sentenced to death, it will be the first execution South Korea has carried out in almost 30 years.

Yoon is on trial for insurrection charges, after trying to declare martial law in late 2024 South Korean prosecutors have demanded the death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law declaration in December 2024, in the first insurrection trial of a Korean head of state
Former President Yoon Suk Yeol faces an insurrection​ charge after his failed attempt to put his country under martial law in 2024.
The verdict in Yoon Suk Yeol’s case is expected next month. He faces insurrection charges over a failed push to impose martial law in 2024.
South Korean prosecutor seeks death sentence for ex-leader Yoon over martial law decree AP News

An independent counsel on Tuesday demanded the death sentence for former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol on rebellion charges in connection with his short-lived imposition of martial law in December 2024.

summary: South Korean prosecutors have requested the death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol, who is on trial for insurrection charges related to his failed attempt to impose martial law in December 2024. The verdict is expected next month. If sentenced to death, it would mark South Korea's first execution in nearly 30 years.

title: Civil Rights Figure Claudette Colvin Dies at 86
snippets: Colvin's arrest for not giving up her seat on a segregated bus helped ignite the modern civil rights movement.

title: 2025 Confirmed as Third Hottest Year Globally
snippets: Average temperatures during 2023-2025 exceeded the 1.5C limit set out in the Paris Agreement, data shows.
2025 was the world's third-warmest year on record, EU scientists say Reuters
2025 ranked as the third hottest year on record, barely behind the last two years, and one where regions of the world still saw dangerous and deadly heatwaves.
The planet logged its third hottest year on record in 2025, extending a run of unprecedented heat, with no relief expected in 2026, US researchers and EU climate monitors said Wednesday.

summary: EU and US climate scientists report that 2025 was the third hottest year on record. Global average temperatures from 2023 to 2025 surpassed the 1.5°C threshold set in the Paris Agreement, and many regions experienced severe heatwaves. Experts do not expect relief from high temperatures in 2026.

title: Diamondbacks Acquire Nolan Arenado From Cardinals in Trade
snippets: Nolan Arenado finally agreed to waive his no-trade clause and will be sent from the St. Louis Cardinals to the Arizona Diamondbacks in return for Jack Martinez and cash.
The Diamondbacks acquired third baseman Nolan Arenado in a trade with St. Louis, concluding the Cardinals' year-plus-long effort to deal the eight-time All-Star.

Arenado's modest on-field projection entering his age-35 season plus a no-trade clause meant that there were minimal expectations regarding the Cardinals' ability to reel in a return of significant value.

The Arizona Diamondbacks acquired eight-time All-Star third baseman Nolan Arenado from St. Louis for minor league pitcher Jack Martinez in a trade Tuesday in which the Cardinals are also including $31 million.
